Evolutionary Computation#

Evolutionary computation (EC) is a family of metaheuristics used for optimization of an ObjectiveFunction that are inspired by the process of biological evolution. The algorithms all rely on trial and error and are driven towards optimal solutions through imitating natural selection. Currently, there are three major paradigms provided by CIFY:

  • Differential Evolution (DE)

  • Evolutionary Algorithms (EA)

  • Genetic Algorithms (GA)

It is important to note, however, that CIFY components support the logic necessary to implement other EC algorithms, and you are welcome to post issues if you are struggling to implement an algorithm that may not be well-supported.

This package contains the evolutionary algorithms mentioned previously as well as their major component, evolutionary operators.

Subpackages#

  • Differential Evolution
    • Algorithm
    • Trial Vectors
  • Generic Evolutionary Algorithm
    • Algorithm
  • Generic Genetic Algorithm
    • Algorithm
  • Evolutionary Operators

    • Selection

Individual#

class Individual(chromosome=None, obj_func=None, **kwargs)#

Bases: Agent

Defines an Individual for use in evolutionary computation.

Individual`s are at the core of any evolutionary computation algorithm. When instantiating an :class:`Individual, it is only necessary to supply an ObjectiveFunction. If no chromosome is provided, the elements of the chromosome will be sampled from a uniform distribution within the bounds of the ObjectiveFunction.

__init__(chromosome=None, obj_func=None, **kwargs)#
Parameters:

  • chromosome (Position or array-like) – The initial chromosome.

  • obj_func (ObjectiveFunction) – The objective function used for evaluation and bounds by the Individual.

property position: Position#

Returns the chromosome as a Position object.

property chromosome: Position#

Returns the chromosome as a Position object.

property p_best_position: Position#

Returns the personal best chromosome as a Position object.

property p_best_chromosome: Position#

Returns the personal best chromosome as a Position object.

property social_best_chromosome: Position#

Returns the social or neighbourhood best chromosome as a Position object.

property social_best_pos: Position#

Returns the social or neighbourhood best chromosome as a Position object.

property obj_func: ObjectiveFunction#

Returns the ObjectiveFunction this Individual will be optimizing.

evaluate()#

Evaluates the Individual’s chromosome.

satisfies_constraints()#

Checks whether the Individual satisfies the constraints of its ObjectiveFunction.

copy()#

Creates and returns a copy of the Individual object.

Returns:

A copy of the original individual object.

Return type:

Individual

Utilities#

get_population(n_individuals=50, obj_func=None, n_dimensions=None, upper_bounds=None, lower_bounds=None, **kwargs) → Collection#

Returns a Collection of Individual objects.

Parameters:

  • n_individuals (int, optional) – The number of :class:`Individual`s in the population, defaults to 50.

  • obj_func (ObjectiveFunction) – The ObjectiveFunction to generate a population of :class:`Individual`s for.

  • n_dimensions (int, optional) – The number of dimensions of the ObjectiveFunction search space, used when generating position vectors for each Individual in the population. If an ObjectiveFunction is provided and this field is not populated, defaults to the number of dimensions of the ObjectiveFunction. If no ObjectiveFunction is provided, defaults to 10.

  • upper_bounds (float or array-like of floats, optional) – An array or scalar value representing the upper bounds to initialize individuals within. If an ObjectiveFunction is provided, the individuals will be uniformly distributed within the bounds of the ObjectiveFunction.

  • lower_bounds (float or array-like of floats, optional) – An array or scalar value representing the lower bounds to initialize individuals within. If an ObjectiveFunction is provided, the individuals will be uniformly distributed within the bounds of the ObjectiveFunction.

Returns:

A population of individuals.

Return type:

Collection of :class:`Individual`s

get_populations(n_populations=3, n_individuals=50, obj_func=None, n_dimensions=10, upper_bounds=None, lower_bounds=None, **kwargs) → List[Collection]#

Returns a list of Collection`s of :class:`Individual objects. In other words, a list of populations.

Parameters:

  • n_populations (int, optional) – The number of populations to return, defaults to 3.

  • n_individuals (int or list of ints, optional) – The number of individuals in each population or all populations, defaults to 50.

  • obj_func (ObjectiveFunction) – The ObjectiveFunction to generate populations of :class:`Individual`s for.

  • n_dimensions (int or list of ints, optional) – The number of dimensions of the ObjectiveFunction search space, used when generating position vectors for each individual in the population. If an ObjectiveFunction is provided, this field will not be used.

  • upper_bounds (float or array_like of floats, optional) – An array or scalar value representing the upper bounds to initialize individuals within.

  • lower_bounds (float or array_like of floats, optional) – An array or scalar value representing the lower bounds to initialize individuals within.

Returns:

A list of populations for the given ObjectiveFunction.

Return type:

list of Collection objects
